The card "Fruit of Tizerus" is a common Sorcery in the THB set, illustrated by Daniel Ljunggren. It has a mana cost of {B}. The card's effect is that the target player loses 2 life, and it features an Escape ability costing {3}{B} with the requirement to exile three other cards from your graveyard to recast it from there. The flavor text describes a spiny tree with bitter fruit growing in the realm of Tizerus, outside the palace of Erebos.

The card "Managorger Kraken" is a rare Green creature (Kraken) designed by artist Lucas Graciano. It costs {2}{G} mana to play and initially has 1 power and 1 toughness. This card has the ability 'Trample' and gains a +1/+1 counter whenever a player casts a spell.

The card "Bartizan Bats" is a Creature — Bat with the ability to fly, meaning it can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach. The card features a flavor text: "Swimming in coins proved harder than they'd hoped, but dancing was a jingling delight." It's illustrated by Nils Hamm.
Sixty-four cards share the same uuid across different formats specified in the legalities table.

In the card game set C16, the mythic card "Sidar Kondo of Jamuraa" is a Legendary Creature — Human Knight, illustrated by Ryan Alexander Lee. It has a mana cost of {2}{G}{W}, power of 2, and toughness of 5. The card features abilities like Flanking and Partner and imposes blocking restrictions, making it a formidable option in gameplay.
The earliest released set that contains cards with foreign translations is the Fourth Edition.
The most common release date among the sets that have cards with the keyword "Trample" is July 17, 2015.

The Sorcery card "Stränge des Deliriums", known in English as "Delirium Skeins", costs {4}{G}{G} to cast and causes each player to discard three cards. Illustrated by Aleksi Briclot, this common card conveys a vivid story: "There came a rush, a sudden fire in the mind. Then the two saw only the sooty fog of madness, heard only the crackling of their last thoughts burning away."
The most common language for the foreign cards available in the dataset is Chinese Traditional.

The rare Sorcery card named "Drowned Secrets," illustrated by Alexander Forssberg, costs {1}{U} mana to cast. Its ability allows you to mill two cards whenever you cast a blue spell. This card is available in Arena, MTGO, and paper formats.
